title: Alibaba Brings In $9 Billion On 'Singles Day'
teaser: The holiday celebrates single people in China and has become the biggest online shopping day in that country - and therefore the world.
contentencoded:
November 11th is China’s Singles Day, celebrating single people in China. It’s been embraced by retailers, and has become the biggest online shopping day in that country — and therefore the world.

The Chinese online retailer Alibaba says it brought in a record $9 billion on Singles Day this year. What does the phenomenon say about China — and where e-commerce is going?

Jason Bellini of the Wall Street Journal joins Here & Now‘s Sacha Pfeiffer to talk about Singles Day shopping in China.

Guest

  • Jason Bellini, video reporter and senior producer for the Wall Street Journal. He tweets @jasonbellini.
